Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am a student from Sheffield University with an assignment due on the budget that was discussed on Friday 6th March. I was in attendance but I would like some confirmation please.
What is being done to help the young people in Sheffield regardless of the budget cuts? Do you have records of youth unemployment for 2014-2015? I'd like to compare said statistics to what was said in the council meeting.
Yours faithfully,
Jasmine

RE: Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 1636
Dear Jasmine
Thank you for your request for information regarding Council budget, young
people support and youth unemployment which we received on 11/03/2015.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request, and will be
dealt with under the Freedom of Information Act.  The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Before we can begin to process your Freedom of Information Request, we
would like to clarify what information you require.
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to Council
budget, young people support and youth unemployment which we received on
11/03/2015.
Unfortunately, Sheffield City Council cannot process your requests because
you have not given us your full name.  Section 8 of the Freedom of
Information Act states that you must give us your full name for a request
to be valid.
Could you please let us know your full name to enable us to process your
request.
For further guidance please see the Information Commissioners Office
Guidance “Recognising a request made under the Freedom of Information Act”
– in particular the section entitled “Name of the applicant”, on the link
below:
[1]
http://ico.org.uk/for_organisations/guid...
In addition to the confirmation above we will require further
clarification in regard to the terms of your request and the specific
information you are looking to access. You note your desire to find out
‘What is being done to help the young people in Sheffield regardless of
the budget cuts’. Unfortunately the breadth of this request would be
difficult to comply within the cost threshold of dealing with Freedom of
Infromation Act requests. Details of an extensive range of services the
Council provides are available on the Council website
[2]
http://www.sheffield.gov.uk
including in terms of education, social
care of young people, health, parks and recreation etc. Almost any service
the Council provides could be termed to support young people in some form.
As a result you would need to be specific about a particular area you are
interested in and what information you are hoping to access. Additionally
within this clarification you would need to confirm what you classify as a
young person i.e. is it age 0-18 or as you have noted unemployment in one
element of your request 16-25?
In respect to unemployment statistics the main route for gathering or
analysis of employment statistics is via the Office of National Statistics
would provide numerous data sets about unemployment throughout the country
[3]
http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/index.html
In the meantime, if you have any queries please contact us on 0114
2734567.
The Freedom of Information Act states that we must respond to a Freedom of
Information request within 20 working days, however, the 20 working days
do not include any time spent clarifying a request.  Therefore, once we
have received your clarification, we can continue processing your request
within this time frame.
You can provide your clarification by writing to the address above,
emailing [4][Sheffield City Council request email] or by telephoning 0114 2734567 and asking
for the Information and Knowledge Management Team.
We look forward to hearing from you.
FOI Support Team
Moorfoot Level 8 West Wing
Sheffield S1 4PL
Tel : 0114 20 53478
E-mail : [5]FOI @sheffield.gov.uk
P Please don't print this e-mail unless you really need to
_____________________________________________
